context: Another major addition to the city's museum scene is the Museum of Remembrance and Tolerance (Museo de la Memoria y Tolerancia), inaugurated in early <a0_0>2011<a0_0/>. The brainchild of two young Mexican women as a <a1_0>Holocaust<a1_0/> museum, the idea morphed into a unique museum dedicated to showcasing all major historical events of <a3_0>discrimination and genocide<a3_0/>. Permanent exhibits include those on the Holocaust and other large-scale atrocities. It also houses temporary exhibits; one on Tibet was inaugurated by the Dalai Lama in <a2_0>September 2011<a2_0/>.
